Description: Unique reference identification number for biomass equation source. Links to Reference table.
Unique equation identification number given arbitrarely. Links to Site_Species table.
Equation to calculate biomass (includes coeficients given in original publication)
Algebraic form of the biomass equation (as function of DBH, HT, WD or others)
Tree component characterized by the equation
Parameters included in biomass model (HT: tree height (m); DBH: diameter breast heigh (1.3 m); DBA: diameter at base; WD: wood density)
Species, genus, family, or plant group for which the allometry was developed (sometimes used as proxy species to calculate AGB when a specific-species equation is not available)
Specific taxonomic level for which the biomass equation was developed (species, genus, family or plant group)

Allometric equation category base on extend of original prediction model: "fa_spec" family specific model; "genus_spe" genus specific; "site_spec" and "sp_site_spec"equations built on ForestGEO sites; "sp_spec" predition models focus on a specific species; "generic" equation applicable to a broader regional scale
Field_codes: fa_spec; generic; genus_spec; site_spec; sp_site_spe; sp_spec

Description: Broad geographic location from which trees were sampled to develop the original equation
Latitude and longitude as given in original publication
Latitude expressed in decimal degrees. Positive latitudes are north of the equator, negative latitudes are south of the equator. Used NOAA for conversion: https://www.ngs.noaa.gov/NCAT/
Longitude expressed in decimal degrees. Positive longitudes are east of Prime Meridian, negative longitudes are west of the Prime Meridian. Used NOAA for conversion: https://www.ngs.noaa.gov/NCAT/

Elevation in meters above sea level (sometimes a range is given). Data from original publication or estimated by using an online tool to get elevation from coordinates (https://www.maps.ie/coordinates.html)
Notes pertaining to lat, long, location, or topography
Mean annual temperature in Celsius degrees as original publication or predicted using the latitude and longitude in the WorldClim database.
Mean temperature of the coldest month
Mean temperature of the warmest month
Mean annual precipitation in milimeters (multiply by 25.4 to convert from inch to mm) or predicted using the latitude and longitude in the WorldClim database.
Frost free period (days) as reported or inferred from original publicacion
Climate details not included in equation table
Stand age (or range) as reported or inferred from original publication
Qualitative description of the stand history reported or inferred from original publication
Stand basal as reported in original publication (m2 x ha)
Number of trees per hectare (average or absolute) as reported in original publication
Brief drescription of stand, summarized from original publication, including species composition
General clasification on terrestrial ecosystem (tropical forest, temperate forest, boreal forest, mountain forest, desert, grassland)
Koppen climate classification, estimated using the package 'kgc" (based on lat/long) or by visual estimates from a Koppen zones map, specially for generic equations.
Minimun DBH (cm) sampled to develop the equation
Maximun DBH (cm) sampled to develop the equation
Number of trees sampled to develop the equation
Year(s) of measurement if in publication
DBH unit used in original publication
Field_codes: cm: centimeters; inch: inches; mm: milimeters

Description: Conversion factor applied to convert DBH unit used in original publication into an equivalent expressed in cm. Multiply by number given in table.
Mass or length unit used in original publication
Field_codes: g= grams; kg= kilograms; lbs= pounds; metric_ton= metric ton; Mg= megagrams; m= meters

Description: Conversion factor applied to convert unit used in original publication (mass or length) into an equivalent expressed in kg or m. Multiply by number given in table.

Method used to develop the allometry. Traditionally, this is done by harvesting whole trees, drying, and weighing ("harvest").  However, we anticipate that many future allometries will be developed using ground-based LiDAR ("lidar").
Regression model used in original publication
Original R-squared value given in publication for fitted regression
Comparable models if reported in publication (given equation form)
Whether the regression fit is done with biomass as the response variable (i.e log(biomass) base 10)
Indicates if a correction factor (CF) or a relative standard error (RSE) was included in model
Correction factor for a bias introduced by logarithmic transformation of the data; pulled from original publication. NA indicates that bias correction is icluded in model (and no CF was provided).
Other details on statistical methods
Unique identification or clues given in original publications
Indicates whether or not the original source data is available
Field_codes: NRA - Not Readily Available, Yes=data accesible

Description: Notes or error message to indicate any pitfall that could spoil the AGB estimate based on equation
